title: Bobby Marks' NBA trade deadline guide: What to know about all 30 teams
content: What deals could kick-start the NBA trade deadline? Bobby Marks examines the players, picks and priorities you need to know for all 30 teams.

title: Bills promote Brady to head coach on 5-year deal
content: The Bills have promoted offensive coordinator Joe Brady to head coach on a five-year deal, the team announced Tuesday.

title: McCarthy 'definitely' would like Rodgers to return
content: New Steelers coach Mike McCarthy said he would like to see Aaron Rodgers return as the team's starting quarterback in 2026.

title: Payton: Nix was 'predisposed' to inevitable injury
content: Sean Payton said at his season-ending news conference Tuesday that Denver Broncos quarterback Bo Nix had a preexisting ankle condition that made a fracture inevitable.

title: Mensah, Duke settle dispute as QB eyes Miami
content: Darian Mensah and Duke have agreed to a settlement of their dispute that will clear the way for the quarterback to transfer to another school.

title: Stefanski deflects Mayfield's post: 'Ton of respect'
content: New Falcons head coach Kevin Stefanski took the high road in response to Baker Mayfield's incendiary recent X post.

title: Altuve, Correa to miss WBC due to insurance issue
content: Astros stars Jose Altuve and Carlos Correa will not play in the World Baseball Classic due to insurance issues if they were to be injured in the event.

title: Unit of ICE to have security role at Winter Games
content: Reaction to news that a unit of ICE would have a security role during the Winter Games in Milan set off concern and confusion in Italy on Tuesday.

content: From CFP (and FCS playoff) classics to OT thrillers and what-the-heck moments, this season had it all.

content: Where do stars of tomorrow such as Konnor Griffin and Kevin McGonigle land as we rank baseball's best young players?

content: It's easy to be skeptical about big free agency spending, midtier QB contracts and defensive-minded coaches. But the Seahawks and Patriots proved everyone wrong.

content: Ahead of the Feb. 8 showdown, we have predictions, matchup insight, looming questions and team breakdowns.

content: It's a two-player race for NFL MVP. We made cases for quarterbacks Matthew Stafford and Drake Maye to win the award -- then our experts made their picks.

content: Understanding wins above bubble helps explain why Virginia, which has a 37 NET ranking, is on the outside looking in.

content: Behind the scenes with Denver Broncos coach Sean Payton, before and after his failed fourth-down decision.

content: Colorado is flirting with NHL records for team performance. We dive deep on the NHL's most dominant team.

content: There is less than a week to go in the January transfer window. Here are the Premier League players who still need a move away this month.

content: Former Man City defender reveals how the transfer window can be full of uncertainty, selfishness and betrayal.

content: Cole Palmer, who is reportedly homesick in London, is open to a move to Manchester United. Transfer Talk has the latest.

content: Premier League clubs are corporations that have outgrown the "manager" role that legendary Arsenal and Man United clubs once had. Why?

content: All the rankings, projections, cheat sheets, strategy and analysis you need for the 2026 fantasy baseball season.

content: Andreas Hale breaks down all the action from the last episode of "Raw" before Saturday's Royal Rumble.

title: Get ready for the Senior Bowl: Six predictions and 15 NFL draft prospects to watch in Mobile
content: Our NFL draft experts weigh in on what to expect at the Senior Bowl, from picking out position groups to watch to predicting players who could rise.

title: Benny the Bull picks new number after Derrick Rose's No. 1 jersey retirement
content: Benny the Bull had worn No. 1 since 1969. In honor of Derrick Rose's jersey retirement, the beloved mascot decided to enter a new era.

title: Ranking this weekend's fights: From Lopez-Shakur to Zayas-Baraou
content: Nick Parkinson ranks the weekend's fights from best to worst and breaks down what's at stake in each matchup.

title: Shooting near US‚ÄìMexico border: One critical after Border Patrol-linked incident‚Äî what we know
content: A shooting near the US-Mexico border in Arivaca, Arizona, has left one person in critical condition. The incident involved the US Border Patrol, and authorities, including the FBI and Pima County Sheriff's Department, are investigating. The injured individual received immediate medical attention and was airlifted to a trauma center.

title: 'He set tempo himself': Rahul Dravid on Rohit Sharma redefining India's white-ball cricket
content: Rahul Dravid believes India are clear favorites for the T20 World Cup, highlighting their high success rate and Rohit Sharma's pivotal role in their white-ball resurgence. Dravid credited Sharma's leadership for driving a shift towards aggressive, risk-taking T20 cricket. He also discussed how World Test Championship points pressure is leading to more result-oriented pitches.

title: OpenAI VP Matt Knight shares resignation note on X; CEO Sam Altman replies
content: OpenAI's Chief Information Security Officer, Matt Knight, has stepped down after over five years. Knight, the company's first security hire in 2020, oversaw the growth of its security program to protect a global platform used by millions. He expressed pride in defining AI security and launching the Aardvark project. CEO Sam Altman lauded Knight's significant contributions.

title: Arijit Singh says he‚Äôs not done with music, cites multiple reasons for quitting playback singing
content: Popular Bollywood singer Arijit Singh, who wooed generations with his soulful voice in songs like Tum Hi Ho, Kesariya and Channa Mereya, left fans stunned after announcing that he will no longer take up new assignments as a playback vocalist. While calling time on one chapter of his career, Arijit made it clear that he is not stepping away from music itself.

title: Microsoft and Amazon together take out a full-page ad; point to 'emergency' in Washington
content: Tech giants Microsoft and Amazon, usually fierce rivals, have united to address Washington State's housing crisis.  The companies jointly penned an Op-Ed and took out a full-page ad, highlighting their $1.6 billion commitment to affordable housing. They urge policymakers to simplify building regulations to combat the severe shortage.

title: Anthropic CEO to Zuckerberg: You are wrong to let godfather of Al Yann LeCun leave Meta
content: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei subtly criticized social media entrepreneurs' approach to AI development, contrasting it with scientists' sense of responsibility. This comes as Meta's AI pioneer Yann LeCun departed following disagreements with Mark Zuckerberg over research direction, particularly concerning world models versus large language models. LeCun's exit and subsequent venture highlight a growing divergence in AI philosophies.

title: Kayla Nicole drama linked to Swift‚ÄìKelce wedding delay
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce are dealing with a lot on their plate ever since the end of the regular season for the Kansas City Chiefs after a poor run on the field. Amid all the mess, it seems Travis Kelce‚Äôs ex girlfriend, Kayla Nicole, has stepped into the drama and it has raised eyebrows among fans. Many fans remain confused about Kayla Nicole‚Äôs actions.

title: Top 5 NFL coaches under 40 and what they earn today
content: The NFL's coaching landscape is changing. Meet the five head coaches under 40 earning millions while leading top franchises, including Super Bowl winner Sean McVay and rising stars like Ben Johnson.

title: Anna Kupp sparks debate wearing Seahawks coat against Rams in NFC showdown
content: Cooper Kupp‚Äôs NFC Championship appearance against his former Rams blended football and family into one powerful moment. Now with the Seahawks, the Super Bowl MVP faced his past while drawing strength from his wife Anna and their three sons. The matchup symbolized resilience, loyalty, and a fresh chapter driven by purpose.

title: Patrick Mahomes rehabs quietly as Brittany Mahomes ensures stability for their kids
content: Patrick Mahomes is enduring a demanding offseason as he recovers from an ACL and LCL tear, limiting his usual family routine. While he focuses on rehabilitation and a possible Week 1 return, Brittany Mahomes is creating joyful moments for their children, helping maintain normalcy as the Chiefs star patiently works through recovery.

title: Travis Kelce supports Taylor Swift amid legal troubles as wedding plans pause
content: Travis Kelce has become a steady source of support for Taylor Swift as she navigates emotional strain linked to ongoing legal troubles around her inner circle. While staying publicly silent, Swift has leaned on Kelce‚Äôs guidance to protect her peace, set boundaries, and address personal tensions directly, even as wedding plans remain on pause.

title: Samantha Ruth Prabhu shares proud moment at Rashtrapati Bhavan
content: Samantha Ruth Prabhu attended the Republic Day At-Home Reception at Rashtrapati Bhavan, a moment she described as a dream once too big to imagine. The actress shared her gratitude for a country that allowed her hard work and perseverance to lead her to such national recognition. Her presence highlighted her journey from a worker bee to a celebrated national figure.

title: India-EU FTA: Can 'mother of all trade deals' offset impact of Trump's tariffs? Explained
content: Once operational, around 93% of India‚Äôs exports are set to gain duty-free entry into European markets, while Indian consumers are likely to see lower prices on premium European imports such as luxury automobiles and wines. With the US as one of the largest trading partners of India, Trump‚Äôs 50% tariffs have dented its exports.

title: 'I won't stop making music': Arijit Singh announces retirement from playback singing
content: In a move that has sent shockwaves across the music industry, superstar singer Arijit Singh has announced his retirement from playback singing. The much-loved vocalist revealed that he will no longer take up any new assignments as a playback singer.

title: India‚ÄìEU FTA: Top winners and losers of the 'mother of all trade deals'
content: India and the European Union have finalised a landmark free trade agreement after 20 years of talks. This deal will significantly boost Indian exports to the EU, especially in textiles, gems, and seafood. While some sectors like apparel and jewellery will see immediate benefits with zero-duty access, Indian car and liquor companies may face increased competition.

title: Why 2026 could be India‚Äôs private space take-off year
content: India's 2026 space calendar is marked by a surge in private sector involvement, despite an early launch setback. Key milestones include a major Earth Observation Satellite System project and the development of 31 satellites for strategic surveillance by private entities. Rocket startups are poised for commercial launches, signaling a new era for India's space economy.

title: 'Invited only one or two days before': Tharoor skips another Cong meet, says he was in Dubai
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor missed another crucial party meeting, citing a late invitation and pre-planned Dubai travel. Returning from his trip, he stated he would convey his concerns directly to the leadership. Tharoor's recent praise for Prime Minister Modi has reportedly led to him being sidelined from party activities.

title: Threads of partnership: EU President Ursula and PM Modi twin in Eri silk scarf
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen gained social media attention for twinning in traditional Eri silk scarves during her India visit. The visit also saw the announcement of a landmark India-EU Free Trade Agreement, hailed as the 'mother of all deals,' aiming to deepen economic ties and create a vast free trade zone.

title: NHL rumour: Blues could move Schenn, Faulk or Binnington
content: The upcoming NHL trade deadline marks the beginning of the St. Louis Blues becoming an important team to monitor because their experienced players have attracted interest from other teams. The management team of the organization has established high trade values for Brayden Schenn, Justin Faulk, and other players, while they show no intention of making immediate personnel changes.

title: U-19 World Cup: Malhotra, Sooryavanshi star as India dismantle Zimbabwe
content: India launched their U-19 World Cup Super Six campaign with a dominant 204-run victory over Zimbabwe. Vihaan Malhotra's unbeaten century anchored a formidable 352/8, supported by Abhigyan Kundu's fluent 61.  Zimbabwe's chase faltered early, succumbing to India's disciplined bowling attack for 148, securing India a commanding start to the next stage.

title: Tamil Nadu assembly election: Can Vijay's TVK convert fan frenzy into votes?
content: Actor Vijay's foray into Tamil Nadu politics with his party TVK mirrors past celebrity transitions, but his decision to quit films entirely sets him apart. While his fan base is large and organized, the success of TVK hinges on converting this popularity into votes, a challenge that has tripped up other stars.

title: India-EU FTA: Was Trump a 'unifier' behind 'mother of all deals' - what Piyush Goyal said
content: India and the European Union have concluded negotiations for a landmark free trade agreement, described as the "mother of all deals." Union commerce minister Piyush Goyal dismissed any US role in the pact, emphasising its independent nature. The agreement, expected to be implemented by 2026, aims to boost trade and investment between the two economic powerhouses.

title: 'Moral duty': UP officer quits after Shankaracharya's remarks on PM Modi and CM Yogi
content: A Uttar Pradesh GST Deputy Commissioner in Ayodhya, Prashant Kumar Singh, has resigned citing moral reasons and support for CM Yogi Adityanath and PM Narendra Modi. Singh stated he was deeply hurt by allegations against the leaders and felt it was his duty to take a stand. He plans to engage in social work after his resignation is accepted.

title: Jos Buttler scripts history, becomes only the second player to‚Ä¶
content: Jos Buttler achieved a significant milestone, becoming the second England player to play 400 international matches during the third ODI against Sri Lanka.  The wicketkeeper-batter has amassed over 12,000 international runs, solidifying his status as a key white-ball player. Buttler is also slated to participate in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026.

title: Rasmus Dahlin‚Äôs fianc√©e shares heartbreaking offseason loss for Sabres captain
content: Buffalo captain Rasmus Dahlin and Carolina Matovac revealed they lost their first child during a medical emergency last year. Matovac's pregnancy prompted a hospital visit that ultimately saved her life when she suffered sudden heart failure, leading to a life-saving heart transplant. The couple honored their baby, calling their child their hero.

title: Mamta Kulkarni steps down as Maha Mandleshwar of Kinnar Akhada: 'Will practice in silence'
content: Mamta Kulkarni has once again taken a decision that has surprised many. The former Bollywood actor has announced that she is stepping down as Maha Mandleshwar of the Kinnar Akhada, saying her spiritual journey no longer requires positions, titles or formal recognition.

title: Why this 75-year-old conductor was awarded the Padma Shri
content: Anke Gowda, a 75-year-old former bus conductor, has been honored with a Padma Award for establishing Pustaka Mane, a library in Karnataka housing 20 lakh books.  He dedicated his life's savings and sold property to build this vast collection, making knowledge accessible to all in his village.

title: 'Turmoil in global environment': PM Modi's 'double engine' pitch after India-EU 'historic' FTA
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced a historic free trade agreement between India and the European Union, emphasizing a "double engine" growth approach amid global turmoil. This "biggest free trade agreement" aims to provide stability and common prosperity, unlocking new opportunities for India's labor-intensive products and service sectors.

title: Not just 'mother of all deals': FTA with EU and 7 other trade pacts signed by India since 2021
content: India has inked its eighth Free Trade Agreement since 2021 with the European Union, a landmark deal hailed as the 'mother of all deals'. This pact, finalized during the Republic Day celebrations, significantly expands market access for Indian exports across numerous sectors to 27 EU nations, promising enhanced trade and economic ties.

title: 'Drunk driving': Former Indian cricketer rams into parked cars
content: Former India cricketer Jacob Martin was arrested early Tuesday after his SUV crashed into three parked cars in Vadodara. Police allege Martin, 53, was driving under the influence of alcohol when he lost control of his vehicle. The incident, which caused significant damage, has led to a case being registered against the ex-batsman.

title: My cat is my dog: Why Trump ally Scott Bessent needs to watch 'Yes, Minister'
content: ‚ÄãBessent‚Äôs argument collapses the moment it is viewed through the prism of logic, because it mistakes activity for responsibility and motion for meaning. When Vladimir Putin invaded Ukraine in 2022, India was importing barely 1‚Äì2% of its crude oil from Russia. It was not a factor in the global energy equation at all.

title: BAFTA Awards 2026: Farhan Akhtar-backed Manipuri film 'Boong' gets nominated
content: The Manipuri film 'Boong' has made waves by securing a BAFTA nomination for Best Children's and Family Film, a remarkable milestone for Indian cinema. Under the banner of Farhan Akhtar‚Äôs Excel Entertainment, this coming-of-age tale, directed by Lakshmipriya Devi, narrates the touching journey of a young boy striving to reunite with his father.

title: From academic debate to institutional scrutiny: Inside IIT Delhi‚Äôs caste conference fallout
content: IIT Delhi‚Äôs decision to appoint a fact-finding committee after a controversial conference on caste and race marks a shift from academic debate to institutional reckoning. Sparked by the political reading of one session, the episode now centres on governance, accountability and where India‚Äôs most symbolic technical institutions draw the line between scholarship and reputational risk.

title: One Injured In Shooting Involving US Border Patrol In Arizona
content: One person was shot and in critical condition Tuesday in a shooting involving the Border Patrol near the U.S.- Mexico border, authorities in Arizona said.

title: US Says Taking First Steps To Possibly Reopen Embassy In Venezuela
content: The Trump administration has notified Congress that it is taking the first steps to possibly reopen the shuttered US Embassy in Venezuela as it explores restoring relations with the South American country.

title: Netanyahu Says Israel Focusing On Disarming Hamas, Demilitarising Gaza
content: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Tuesday that Israel would turn its focus to disarming Hamas and demilitarising Gaza following the return of the last hostage from the Palestinian territory.

title: Iran Warns Against "Instability" After US Strike Group Arrives
content: Iran's president on Tuesday warned US "threats" against the Islamic republic would only cause instability, as a US naval strike group led by an aircraft carrier took up position in Middle Eastern waters.

title: IndiGo Flights To Tbilisi, Almaty, Tashkent, Baku Now Cancelled Till Feb 11
content: IndiGo on Tuesday extended the cancellation of flights to Tbilisi, Almaty, Baku and Tashkent till February 11 due to the prevailing situation in Iran.

title: US To Conduct Multi-Day Military Exercise In Middle East
content: The United States on Tuesday announced a major multi-day Air Force exercise in the Middle East, as Washington and Tehran face off over Iran's deadly crackdown on anti-government demonstrations.

title: Yak Cheese, Guchhi: Himalayan Menu At Rashtrapati Bhavan Banquet For EU
content: A curated menu celebrating India's Himalayan culinary heritage was served at a banquet hosted by President Droupadi Murmu at Rashtrapati Bhavan on Tuesday in honour of European Union leaders Antonio Costa and Ursula von der Leyen.

title: J&K Doctor Rides Excavator To Reach Hospital To Perform Surgeries
content: Braving treacherous weather and waist-deep snow, a doctor posted in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian district on Tuesday proved that a sense of duty can triumph over even nature's harshest challenges as he reached his hospital atop an excavator to attend

title: How India Stack Helped Build Cashless, Paperless Digital Economy
content: India's ambitious digital journey over the past decade has been powered by a unique framework known as the India Stack, which has helped the country build a cashless, paperless and presence-less digital ecosystem at scale, a report has said.

title: Woman Who Lost Husband In Covid Allowed To Settle Loan On Relaxed Terms
content: The Supreme Court has granted relief to a widow who lost her husband during the second wave of Covid-19 by permitting her to settle a bank loan on relaxed terms.

title: India-EU Summit 2026: Delivered 'Mother Of All' Trade Deals With India, Says EU Chief
content: India-EU Summit Highlights: India and the EU have concluded negotiations on the much-awaited Free Trade Agreement (FTA), and the announcement of the conclusion of talks will be made at the 16th India-EU Summit.

title: Man, 55, Dies By Suicide As Villagers Assault, Torture Daughter
content: A man allegedly died by suicide after his daughter was assaulted, humiliated, and publicly tortured by some villagers in Odisha's Bhadrak district, police said on Tuesday.

title: Cancel Transfers Of Officers Deputed As SIR Observers: Poll Body To Bengal
content: The tussle between the Election Commission and the West Bengal government escalated on Tuesday as the poll body directed the state to cancel the transfer of three IAS officers deputed as electoral roll observers.

title: "India-EU Business Forum Great Platform To Discuss Economic Links": PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said on Tuesday that the India-EU Business Forum was a platform for discussing ranging economic linkages between India and Europe.

title: "India-EU Summit Will Derisk Global Order," Says S Jaishankar
content: External Affairs Minister (EAM) S Jaishankar on Tuesday said that the India-European Union (EU) summit would strengthen multipolarity and help derisk the global order.

title: Baby's Head Severed During Forced Home Delivery In UP, ASHA Worker Charged
content: A newborn baby boy's head got severed during delivery as an ASHA worker and a midwife allegedly forced the birth despite complications in Bulandshahr district, an official said on Tuesday.

title: Delhi Woman Convicted For 'Unleashing' Pet Dog On Employee Over Salary Row
content: A Delhi court has convicted a woman for attempting culpable homicide and negligent conduct with respect to an animal after her pet dog attacked a former employee, causing grievous and life-threatening injuries to the victim's face and neck.

title: India Eyes Canada's Critical Minerals, Prepares Collaboration Talks
content: India is keen on investing in extraction of critical minerals in Canada and will mount a delegation soon to discuss joint collaboration in the sector, Oil Minister Hardeep Singh Puri said Tuesday.

title: India's Neighbours Should Know What Democracy Is About: UK Speaker
content: Describing India as the "mother of all democracies", Speaker of the UK House of Commons Sir Lindsay Hoyle has said some of its neighbouring countries should reflect on what democracy truly means.

title: Imran Khan Suffering From Serious Eye Ailment, Party Demands Immediate Care
content: The Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf party on Tuesday claimed that its jailed founder Imran Khan was suffering from a serious eye ailment that could cause permanent damage to his eyesight if not treated promptly.

title: Excise in Kochi steps up anti-drug drive with new intelligence wing
content: Two teams, comprising 22 officials, deployed to gather intelligence on suspected trafficking of narcotic items and other contraband; excise in talks with Narcotics Control Bureau to expand intelligence network

title: A political dust storm over the Singareni coal mines
content: The Congress and the BRS are involved in mudslinging over the alleged irregularities in tenders for removal of overburden in the coal mines.

title: Stalin launches project for women‚Äôs safety, HPV vaccination initiative at global summit
content: Tamil Nadu Women Employment and Safety Project will promote sustainable and inclusive economic development through targeted interventions for employment, safety, and empowerment. The vaccination drive will begin in Ariyalur, Dharmapuri, Perambalur, and Tiruvannamalai districts

title: After AIADMK comes to power, families of tamers killed in jallikattu will be given ‚Çπ10 lakh, says Palaniswami
content: He also says insurance cover will be extended to all registered bull tamers and the participating bulls

title: Kerala HC flays SIT‚Äôs ‚Äòdelay‚Äô in filing chargesheet in Sabarimala gold theft case
content: Court cites how a delay could lead to persons who had been arraigned as accused in the case getting statutory bail

title:
A.P. govt. rolls out SOP for scientific 
de-siltation of urban drains
content: The SOP mandates replacing sporadic, reactive drain cleaning with a planned, technology-driven and accountability-based system, says official

title: Integrated laboratories in 13 Area Hospitals in A.P. to be ready by April
content: 134 tests relating to communicable and non-communicable diseases can be performed at these labs being set up under PM-ABHIM at a cost of ‚Çπ16.25 crore

title: Jailed MP Rashid expresses concern over ‚Äòharassment‚Äô of journalists in Kashmir
content: Various State and non-State actors wanted them to carry narratives of their choice, but most of these journalists resisted,‚Äù MP Engineer Rashid said

title: Railways to serve¬†non-vegetarian food on Howrah-Guwahati Vande Bharat Express
content: The move comes after demand for non-vegetarian food on the train by a section of passengers, and the support of some BJP leaders from West Bengal

title: In a first, private technical staff to assist officials in Census
content: Registrar General and Census Commissioner of India Mritunjay Kumar Narayan tells States and Union Territories that the target is to ‚Äòget the digitised data from the field itself‚Äô; manpower will be hired on contract through outsourcing agencies

title: CPI(M) slams India-EU FTA as ‚Äòsurrender of economic interests‚Äô
content: Party says steep tariff cuts will hit jobs, hurt domestic industries, and deepen ties with Israel amid the Gaza crisis

title: Nashik to Mumbai long march likely to be withdrawn on January 28 after assurance from CM Fadnavis
content: A delegation of CPI(M) and All India Kisan Sabha held a meeting with five Ministers and several officials of Maharashtra government, for a few hours in the State Secretariat on Tuesday (January 27, 2026) afternoon

title: Maharashtra government temporarily suspends eviction of tribals from Sanjay Gandhi National Park
content: The eviction drive was carried out in compliance with the Bombay High Court and its appointed High Power Committee orders, as per Sanjay Gandhi National Park officials

title: Prime Minister lauds ‚Äòambitious‚Äô trade deal with European Union
content: ‚ÄòHistoric‚Äô FTA a boost to investment between India and the European Union, says Modi; pact brings together Indian services and skills with European capital and innovations, says EU chief; deal ‚Äòopens a whole new world‚Äô, says Union Home Minister

title: Terror suspect held by Gujarat ATS
content: The accused, Faizan Shaikh, had illegally procured a weapon and ammunition with the intention of targeting a specific group in order to spread fear and terror, officials said

title: SIR hearing: Place in electoral roll is a ‚Äòqualified right‚Äô, Election Commission says in Supreme Court
content: SIR seeks to verify, not determine citizenship, says Election Commission; adds that a place in the electoral roll is a ‚Äúqualified right‚Äù, according to eligibility parameters in the Constitution, Representation of the People Act

title: New UGC equity regulations spark student protests, political fallout in U.P.
content: Section of students demonstrates at Lucknow University, claiming the University Grants Commission (Promotion of Equity in Higher Education Institutions) Regulations, 2026,¬†could lead to caste conflict and disrupt social harmony on campuses.¬†

title: BJP president Nitin Nabin visits West Bengal
content: Instead of visiting Kolkata, the BJP president chose Durgapur and Asansol in the south western part of the State. The region has a strong BJP presence and the party‚Äôs performance in this part of the state is crucial in the upcoming assembly polls

title: Only two Nipah Virus Disease cases reported in West Bengal since December 2025
content: A total of 196 contacts linked to the confirmed cases have been identified, traced, monitored, and tested. All traced contacts have been found asymptomatic and have tested negative

title: U.P. official quits job to extend support to Yogi Adityanath in Shankaracharya row
content: Prashant Kumar Singh, posted as Deputy GST Commissioner in Ayodhya, sent his resignation to the Governor

title: DMK delegation to meet Rahul Gandhi over sharing of seats
content: According to sources in both parties, DMK Parliamentary Party leader Kanimozhi Karunanidhi is set to meet Mr. Gandhi to convey her party high-command‚Äôs offer of seats for the Assembly election

title: Labour unions welcome Karnataka‚Äôs welfare board for Gig workers, seek stronger social security
content: Under the framework notified by the State government, both aggregator platforms and gig workers will¬†be required¬†to register with the welfare board

title: Congress to press MGNREGA, SIR, foreign policy concerns in Budget session; Opposition to meet
content: Environmental concerns, including the redefinition of the Aravalli hills and the Great Nicobar project, would also be flagged the party, Congress leader and Rajya Sabha Whip Naseer Hussain says

title: No discrimination under new UGC equity rules, says Education Minister
content: ABVP says regulations ‚Äúwell-intentioned‚Äù but require ‚Äúclarity and balance‚Äù; NSUI welcomes the regulations

title: Physiotherapists, occupational therapists can use the ‚ÄòDr.‚Äô title, says Kerala HC
content: The court noted that the National Medical Commission Act does not contain any provision conferring the title ‚ÄúDr.‚Äù exclusively on medical professionals

title: EU, India commit to collaboration on ‚Äòpeaceful uses‚Äô of nuclear power
content: Statement also cites ‚Äúdeepening cooperation‚Äù under the EU research and innovation programme, including in the fields of energy, water, agri food, health, semiconductors, biotech, advanced materials

title: Expect a realistic and practical State Budget: Balagopal
content: Finance Minister ‚Äî whose sixth Budget is also the final one of the present LDF government as Kerala moves towards the Assembly elections ‚Äî says his presentation on Thursday will reflect the LDF conviction that it will continue in power in the State

title: New Labour Codes will help protect workers‚Äô interests and boost jobs, says Union Minister
content: Shobha Karandlaje says these reforms will ensure transparency, social security and ease of doing business, calls for strong Centre‚ÄìState coordination

title: BRS leaders meet Governor, urge him to recommend probe into Singareni OB tenders
content: Opposition party flags alleged irregularities in solar power projects, explosives supply in Singareni

title: Railway stations renovation work in Thiruvananthapuram Division to be completed in February, says DRM
content: Besides the renovated Chirayinkeezhu and Kulitturai stations ‚Äì inaugurated by the Prime Minister recently ‚Äì 11 additional stations undergoing renovation will be opened by February

title: Twenty20‚Äôs entry into NDA was not to evade ED case, says Sabu Jacob
content: He say  the ED had issued notice to the company in May last year seeking relevant documents for the last few years since the COVID-19 pandemic as part of the usual procedure to verify whether the entire value of its foreign exports had been realised in India

title: City student among top 100 in Veer Gatha initiative
content: Project Veer Gatha 5.0 encourages students to create projects celebrating the bravery and life stories of gallantry awardees and great Indian warriors

title: FCV tobacco farmers urge rollback of steep excise duty hike
content: Delegation from four districts tells Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu that over 70% increase has hit auctions, prices and rural livelihoods, and fuelled illicit cigarette trade

title: JNCASR and Bengaluru company tie-up for smarter cooling of aviation batteries
content: This collaboration is expected to address critical challenges in drone performance, safety and operational endurance

title: No new housing units permissible on the sites of three demolished Maradu apartments, says KCZMA
content: The apartments were demolished six years ago for violating Coastal Regulation Zone rules;  residential units can be constructed on the property where Golden Kayaloram apartment once stood, says panel

title: Reports of negligence at Vilappil health centre baseless: KGMOA
content: The association calls for strict action against those disrupting the functioning of the health facility

title: Hundreds of daily wage workers take out protest march in Dharwad
content: Repeal Viksit Bharat-Guarantee for Rozgar and Ajeevika Mission (Gramin) Act, demands All India Kisan Khet Majdoor Sangathan

title: Acquire, auction assets of acid attackers to pay their victims: Supreme Court
content: Acid attacks should result in ‚Äúextraordinary punitive measures beyond the letters of the law‚Äù, says CJI; asks Centre to consider ‚Äúlegislative interventions‚Äù, shift onus to accused; rejects ‚Äúreformative approach‚Äù

title: Political motives force NSS to step back from alliance with SNDP
content: Explaining the decision to withdraw, NSS general secretary G. Sukuaran Nair said the organisation stepped back after realising that a political agenda lay behind the move. He maintains that his call for unity between the two major Hindu community organisations was sincere, but said it later became evident that those who raised the issue of unity were driven by political considerations

title: Fifth Loka Kerala Sabha to begin on January 29
content: Three-day meet will begin with Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan inaugurating the public meeting at 5 p.m. at the Nishagandhi auditorium

title: TDP MP flags tobacco crisis, Amaravati status at all-party meet in Delhi
content: Lavu Srikrishnadevarayalu urges debate on GST impact on farmers, highlights Jal Jeevan Mission fund utilisation gap and calls for social media restrictions for under-16s

title: New sub-stations to ensure quality, uninterrupted power supply: A.P. Energy Minister
content: 10-12 more sub-stations will be established in Nellore district to eliminate low-voltage problems, says Gottipati Ravi Kumar

title: SYL canal talks inconclusive as Punjab, Haryana agree to continue dialogue
content: Chief Ministers hold cordial meeting in Chandigarh, decide on further discussions at officials‚Äô level

title: Boxing divisional rankings: Muratalla climbs after IBF title defense over Cruz
content: the lightweights were separated by one punch on CompuBox, but Muratalla appeared to land the harder punches . it was the first time that the lightweight champion fought past 10 rounds in his seven-fight pro career . he moves up to no. 4 from no. 6 in the ESPN lightweight rankings .

title: 4B movement: The 'four nos' that scared patriarchy ‚Äî Is India ready?
content: Aastha Jha is a writer at The Times of India, covering politics, business and global affairs. She also writes on social issues, with a focus on policy, governance and their impact on everyday lives. Her work brings together reportage and analysis, tracking developments in India and abroad while examining the broader social and economic currents shaping public discourse. Read More

title: MMA divisional rankings: 10 ranked fighters at UFC 324 -- and only one moved
content: the men's flyweight fight won by Natalia Silva did not produce a change in that top 10 . the only rankings change came at heavyweight, where Waldo Cortes-Acosta moved up one spot to no. 6 .

title: Madras HC says there is no religion for encroachment, orders removal of church
content: the commissioner (of the local body) is statutorily required to remove the superstructure after due notice . justice V Lakshminarayanan ordered the removal of a shrine of Mother Velankanni constructed in SRP Kovil Street (North), Thiru Vi Ka Nagar, Kolathur, Chennai, on a public road .

title: After Clippers' 15-3 run, fan follows through on eating his words
content: the LA Clippers defeated the Brooklyn Nets 126-89 on a 15-3 stretch dating back to December . fans remembered Flom's post on X as soon as the final buzzer sounded . he stayed true to his word, saying he would indeed eat a printout of his post .

title: Boycott families if kids opt for love marriage: MP village panchayat
content: 'Khap-style' decree sparked tension in panchewa village panchayat . it calls for total social and economic boycott of the families whose children opt for love marriages . 'we are conducting 'Jan Samvad' (public dialogue) in the village .

title: UCLA's Bob Chesney: Coal miner, bartender, coach of the Bruins
content: new coach Bob Chesney has mined coal, slung Red Bull and vodkas behind a bar . he has worked every on-field job from strength coach to special teams coach . "he's the kind of guy I want to get in the foxhole with," athletic director says .

title: MLB's top five breakout teams for 2026: A healthier Braves squad? A bounce-back in Baltimore?
content: a breakout team is a club that wins at least 10 more games than what would be expected by its established level of play . we'll use wins per 162 games for the previous two seasons, while giving double weight to the most recent season . last season, the highest baseline win level was the Los Angeles Dodgers .

title: Defence partnership a landmark departure, based on trust: EU
content: the signing of a security and defence partnership agreement marks the highest point in bilateral ties . both sides announced the launch of negotiations for a . security of information agreement for exchange of classified information . despite the differences over the . Russia-Ukraine war, the launch was a landmark departure and a trust-based platform for . cooperation .

title: MLS, Polymarket join forces in prediction markets
content: the NHL became the first major professional U.S. league to announce a deal with prediction markets in October last year . prediction markets such as Polymarket and Kalshi allow users to trade on the yes/no outcome of events .

title: Op Trashi-I: Searches continue in Kishtwar after fresh gunfight
content: a joint team of security forces has been combing the dense forests of J&K‚Äôs Kishtwar district for the past two days . the first fire exchange between troops and terrorists occurred in Sonnar village near Mandral-Singhpora on Jan 18 . on Jan 22, another gunfight broke out with holed-up ultras . another firefight followed in which a jaish-e-Mohammad terrorist was shot dead .

title: Texas freezes H-1B hiring: Governor directs state agencies, universities to halt visa petitions

title: Wetzel: Let football be football. And let it snow.
